awd_titl_txt: Sensory Transduction: A Symposium at Woods Hole,            Massachusetts; September 5-8, 1991
awd_abstract_narration: Sensory transduction is the initial step of stimulus                            reception in sensory systems, in which the capture of energy of a               stimulus (such as a light, sound, touch, or chemical) is                        converted into a neural signal to be sent to the brain.  This                   symposium will focus on the molecular mechanisms of sensory                     transduction, on the initial events in the receptor cells.  The                 issues of stimulus sensitivity, discrimination, amplification,                  and adaptation will be covered for a several different sensory                  systems, by a multidisciplinary group of speakers and                           participants.  This conference and the publication of the                       symposium volume will have an important impact across this                      currently very active field of sensory research in neuroscience.
